intro: Combretum mooreanum, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that appear in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has simple, opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The bark is smooth and may develop a reddish hue, adding to its visual appeal.
